column25:
rest("/test").get().type(ClassA.class).to("direct:someRoute");

rest("/testSub").get().type(ClassB.class).to("direct:someOtherRoute");
"
column26: And in the type ClassA contains a reference to ClassB.
column27: Within the Swagger Doc the path for ClassA renders as expected:
column28:
/test:
    get:
      responses:
        200:
          schema:
            $ref: '#/definitions/ClassA'
"
column29: However ClassB gets a string parameter scheme
column30:
/testSub:
    get:
      responses:
        200:
          schema:
             type : 'string'
             format : 'com.ClassB'
"
column31: However I'd expect it to be:
column32:
/testSub:
    get:
      responses:
        200:
          schema:
            $ref: '#/definitions/ClassB'
"
